bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Richard Roley, March 27, 1948

div1.p: Hench writes that it is very kind of Roley and Law to offer Cornwell's painting “The Conquerors of Yellow Fever” for the Fourth International Congress on Tropical Medicine.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to Richard Roley, March 27, 1948
div1.opener:
March 27, 1948
Mr. Richard Roley
Advertising Manager
Wyeth, Incorporated
1600 Arch Street
Philadelphia 3, Pennsylvania
My dear Mr. Roley:
div1.p:
It was extremely kind of Mr. Law and
you to offer to Colonel Dart Cornwell's painting
“The Conquerors of Yellow Fever” for the Fourth
International Congress on Tropical Medicine.

As I wrote Mr. Law, they have asked me
to help set up an exhibit and it was my suggestion
that they consider borrowing your painting. If they
don't, they ought to have their heads examined, as
that painting would be one of the nicest parts
of any exhibit.

As your P.S. indicates, you realize that
I have nothing to do with the exhibit. I am merely
helping them. I am sure Colonel Dart will be
pleased at your offer, and you will doubtless
hear from him.
div1.closer: Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH:alc
